RautSoft.math.calculus
Class Integration

java.lang.Object
  RautSoft.math.calculus.Integration

public class Integration
extends java.lang.Object

The package contains two main classes, Integration and Differentiation, each containing several static methods that can perform integration and differentiation of a function of one or more variables. The functions are passed as The following are main integration methods:

  • Gaussian Quadrature see qgaus(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b)
  • Romberg's method see qromb(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b)
  • Simpson's Rule see qsimp(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b)
  • Trapezoid's Rule, see trapzd(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b, int n)
The default values of JMAX=20 and EPS=1.0e-10 could be changed before calling a method. The computations algorithms are adopted from Numerical Recipe book, and various other books and published articles.

Usage Example 

 import RautSoft.Interfaces.FunctionOfOneVariable;
 import static RautSoft.math.calculus.Integration.*;

  public class IntegrationEx {
      public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Here is the output");
        //Implementing the interfact of Onevariable funciton
        FunctionOfOneVariable f2 = new FunctionOfOneVariable() {
            public double value(double x) {
                return (x);
            }
        };

        double a = 0, b = 1;
        double result = trapzd(f2, a, b, 1);
        System.out.println("Using Trapezoid rule trapzd() with n = 1 is " +
        result);
        result = qtrap(f2, a, b, 1);
        System.out.println("Using Trapezoid rule qtrap() with JMAX=20 is " +
        result);
    }
 }

Method Summary
static double qgaus(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b)
          Returns the integral of the function func between a and b, by ten-point Gauss-Legendre integration: the function is evaluated exactly ten times at interior points in the range of integration.
static double qromb(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b)
          Returns the integral of the function func from a to b using Romberg's method.
static double qsimp(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b)
          Returns the integral of the function func from a to b using Simson's rule.
static double qtrap(FunctionOfOneVariable func, double a, double b, int n)
          Returns the integral of the FunctionOfOneVariable func from double a to double b.

Method Detail

qtrap

public static double qtrap(FunctionOfOneVariable func,
                           double a,
                           double b,
                           int n)
Returns the integral of the FunctionOfOneVariable func from double a to double b. The parameters EPS can be set to the desired fractional accuracy and JMAX so that 2 to the power JMAX-1 is the maximum allowed number of steps. Integration is performed by the trapezoidal rule.

Parameters:
func - the function of one variable to be integratred, a FunctionOfOneVariable
a - from a, a double
b - to b, a double
n - the number of sub-divisions, an int
Returns:
error estimate of the integral, a double

qsimp

public static double qsimp(FunctionOfOneVariable func,
                           double a,
                           double b)
Returns the integral of the function func from a to b using Simson's rule. The parameters EPS can be set to the desired fractional accuracy and JMAX so that 2 to the power JMAX-1 is the maximum allowed number of steps.

Parameters:
func - the function of one variable to be integratred, a FunctionOfOneVariable
a - from a, a double
b - to b, a double
Returns:
value of the integral, a double

qromb

public static double qromb(FunctionOfOneVariable func,
                           double a,
                           double b)
Returns the integral of the function func from a to b using Romberg's method. The parameters EPS can be set to the desired fractional accuracy and JMAX so that 2 to the power JMAX-1 is the maximum allowed number of steps.

Parameters:
func - the function of one variable to be integratred, a FunctionOfOneVariable
a - from a, a double
b - to b, a double
Returns:
value of the integral, a double

qgaus

public static double qgaus(FunctionOfOneVariable func,
                           double a,
                           double b)
Returns the integral of the function func between a and b, by ten-point Gauss-Legendre integration: the function is evaluated exactly ten times at interior points in the range of integration.

Parameters:
a - from a, a double
b - to b, a double
Returns:
value of the integral, a double
